channel.name: Testing zkProgram with proofsEnabled set to false

messages.content:
I stopped testing with proofsEnabled set to false months ago since my project depends on ZKProgram and it looks like testing the execution of a ZKProgram method with dummy proofs isn't supported.

Is this actually not supported or am I missing something?
If it isn't supported, will it be in the future?

it always was! check out the second half of our workshop - we’re showcasing how to test zkprograms with mock proofs 🙂 

https://youtu.be/hqobPb3gIRo?si=wNxYxLJ2ZPvU2O6A

embeds.title: Introduction to Protokit - Protocol development framework for priva...
embeds.description: Protokit enables developers to build zero-knowledge, interoperable and privacy preserving application chains with a minimal learning curve. This workshop walks through the basics of zero-knowledge proofs, and explains techniques

messages.content: It looks like you are creating dummy proofs manually and tests can't conditionally be executed with or without proofs by setting the proofsEnabled flag, so I wouldn't consider this as "ZKProgram method testing with dummy proofs support", since it differs from the standard pattern where dummy proofs are introduced automatically if you don't compile the smart contract.
I would expect the same behavior during testing when the ZKProgram isn't compiled
there’s no concept of proofsEnabled for zk program, this is your only option currently
and proofsEnabled: false, just adds dummy proofs to your account updates, there’s no other magic afaik
Yep. It's just that the testing pattern becomes different and requires some extra tweaks compared to testing smart contracts
Not a big deal, but I think it's good to be aware that there's a difference
Thanks for the response, @maht0rz :Mina_Mainnet_Toast:
i discussed a potential PR for adding proofsEnabled to ZkProgram with @gregor , but never got to it

It would be neat to automate the testing behavior for ZKProgram too and homogenize it. I feel like  the ZKProgram UX is a little neglected, since for example the zkApp-CLI can't deploy contracts that depend on ZKProgram and you have to create your own script to deploy
We have a primitive within Protokit’s internal architecture that does this, its called ZkProgrammable, and its what makes running runtime modules in/out of the prover/simulation modes respectively
Fully agree, zkprogram is neglected, will create an issue for this

well I'm not sure if zkprogram, being a general purpose zk proving API, should respect an option passed to the Mina-specific `LocalBlockchain`. that seems to mix up the different components too much for me
maybe `proofsEnabled` should be a global switch
which in turn is toggled by LocalBlockchain if you use it as a param there
and the global switch should also return dummy verification keys instead of compiling
and dummy proofs from running zk program methods

added issues
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1206
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1207
